title: Ticket #2481: PROPER build of CREAM
description:
Now that EMI is starting to push out decent RPMs for CREAM, we should have the option of building a PROPER build of CREAM.

OSG might be interested in this, as we would like to use a proper build but we also need to provide CREAM support.

Patch forthcoming.
remarks:
2011-Sep-20 09:00:06 by tstclair:
The modification would be simple, but i'll wait until the rpm's exist.

2012-Apr-05 16:52:02 by bbockelm:
SRPMs exist now: http://emisoft.web.cern.ch/emisoft/dist/EMI/2/RC4/sl5/SRPMS/base/

Not the best-formed RPMs (they don't properly subpackage and miss some of the Fedora guidelines), but are close enough.

Wanna give it a whirl?

attachments:
• proper_cream.diff 2155 bytes added by bbockelm on 2011-Sep-20 13:59:32 UTC.
    A minimal patch to get CREAM working with PROPER builds and the EMI RPMs.

    While creating this, I noted that the current release of the CREAM client API is 1.13.2, while Condor is using 1.12.1.

  • proper_cream_v2.diff 2896 bytes added by matyas on 2012-Jul-16 18:18:48 UTC.
    This is a modification to the proper_cream.diff patch that fixes a link error due to a missing symbol when a PROPER build is trying to link against the GSOAP libs. It just adds a dummy global variable that has the right name and type.
  • cream_el6.patch 753 bytes added by matyas on 2012-Jul-16 18:27:32 UTC.
    A patch to fix the version of the glite_security_gsoap_plugin used in PROPER builds--to be applied on EL6 only.
  • proper_cream_v3.diff 3179 bytes added by matyas on 2012-Jul-16 20:06:34 UTC.
    This is a modification to proper_cream_v2.diff that works on both EL5 and EL6 platforms without needing the cream_el6.patch. It supersedes all previous patches in this ticket.
